title: Welcome to Phage Explorer
description: A quick tour of the web UI: pick a phage, read its genome, and open analyses.

steps.title: Header and status
steps.content: This top bar shows where you are, your keyboard mode, and quick actions like Theme, Contrast, and Beginner Mode.

steps.title: Phage list
steps.content: Browse included phages here. Each entry shows host, genome length, lifecycle, and GC%. Click any phage to load it.

steps.title: Selecting a phage
steps.content: The highlighted row is your current selection. Use j/k to move fast, or click another phage.

steps.title: Details pane
steps.content: Key metadata lives here: genome length, GC content, gene count, lifecycle, and accession.

steps.title: Gene map
steps.content: This map shows gene locations and strands. Click anywhere to jump the sequence viewer to that region.

steps.title: Sequence grid
steps.content: Scroll to move through the genome. Letters are color‑coded by nucleotide or amino‑acid chemistry.

steps.title: DNA vs amino acids
steps.content: Toggle between DNA, Amino Acids, or Dual view. In Amino Acids mode, press f to cycle reading frames.

steps.title: Navigation shortcuts
steps.content: Footer hints show the core hotkeys. Try / for search, ? for help, and Home/End to jump genome ends.

steps.title: Open analyses
steps.content: Press : to open the command palette, then search for analyses like GC skew, complexity, promoters, dot plots, and more.

steps.title: Go deeper
steps.content: With Beginner Mode on, the Learn menu opens foundational modules and the glossary whenever you need context.
